citeinfo.title: Washington State Trails
citeinfo.othercit: The 2017 Washington State Trails Database contains line features and use attributes which have been aggregated and standardized from many public (federal, state, and local entities) and some approved private sources. This database spans multiple time periods and has been collected and developed by management authorities using different methods, scales, and technologies.

descript.abstract: In 2007, Washington State legislators requested a trails database, but funding to complete that statewide project was not made available at the time.In 2009, the Federal Government outlined the need for trails database schema in their Data Standards Review Committee, stressing the efficiency in management decisions that a streamlined database can provide. “The collection, storage and management of trail related data are important components of everyday business activities in many federal and state land-managing agencies, trail organizations and businesses. From a management perspective, trails data must often mesh closely with other types of infrastructure, resource and facility enterprise data.” In 2014, the Washington State Office of the Chief Information Officer's (OCIO) Geospatial Program Office acquired a Nonhighway and Off-Road Vehicle Activities (NOVA) Program grant through the Washington State Recreation and Conservation Office (RCO) giving the OCIO initial funding to develop a statewide trails database based on Federal Geographic Data Committee standards. Using the same standard for all trails data will allow land managers and recreational users throughout the state to access and use the data regardless of administrative boundary. "Data standards will make it easier for trail information to be accessed and exchanged and used by more than one individual agency or group…Ease in sharing data increases the capability for enhanced and consistent mapping, inventory, monitoring, conditions assessment, maintenance, costing, budgeting, information retrieval, and summary reporting for internal and external needs.”Along with streamlining data and facilitating efficiency in management practices across agencies, the database will provide a source of trails information that is open and free to the public. Additional details about the project can be found here: http://www.rco.wa.gov/recreation/WashingtonStateTrailsMap.shtml
descript.purpose: The 2017 Washington State Trails Database contains line features and use attributes which have been aggregated and standardized from many public (federal, state, and local entities) and some approved private sources. This database spans multiple time periods and has been collected and developed by management authorities using different methods, scales, and technologies.
descript.supplinf: The 2017 Washington State Trails Database contains line features and use attributes which have been aggregated and standardized from many public (federal, state, and local entities) and some approved private sources. This database spans multiple time periods and has been collected and developed by management authorities using different methods, scales, and technologies.

idinfo.useconst: Washington's Public Records Disclosure Act (RCW 42.56) was adopted by initiative of the people in 1972 to open government records to the public. The Washington State Office of the Chief Information Officer (OCIO) believes in the importance of the public’s right to know about its operations and activities. This data should not be construed, expressed or implied, as legal advice or legal opinion on any specific facts or circumstances. OCIO discloses this data “as is” without any warranty, and OCIO expressly disclaims all expressed or implied warranties of merchantability and fitness for a particular use.This database is currently in development. Source data was obtained from several organizations at various times and has been modified to meet Federal Trail Data Standards.Every effort has been made to ensure that the data represented is accurate. However, no guarantee can be made regarding the accuracy, reliability, or timeliness of the data.The data may contain typographical errors and other inadvertent inaccuracies or omissions, and the data may not reflect recent management and geographic changes or seasonal closures and maintenance conditions. It is for representative map purposes only. Anyone who uses and relies on any data from this database or on maps created using this data does so at his/her own risk. The OCIO is not liable for the data provided in this database and strongly advises checking with appropriate trail management organizations for current environmental conditions and trail status as part of trip planning and preparation. The data provided in this database should not be construed as a trail guide. By accessing and using this data, the user agrees to indemnify, hold harmless from any claim or demand directed at the OCIO, removing the OCIO from any claim, losses, liabilities, and cost and expense of defense, directly or indirectly made by any third party that arises in connection with use of this data. In no event shall the OCIO be liable to any user or any other person, organization, business, or website, for any loss of measurable or immeasurable economic or personal value due to the presence of this database or the use of its data. Access to this database may be suspended, discontinued, or altered, in part or in whole, at any time, for any reason, with or without prior notice, at the discretion of the OCIO.

enttyp.enttypd: Displays Washington State Trails data as polylines.

attr.attrdef: Indicates whether motorcycles are allowed. Includes any other motorized two-wheeled vehicles on which the two wheels are inline, not side by side.

edom.edomvd: Unknown whether motorcycle use is allowed.

attr.attrdef: Indicates whether ATV use is allowed. ATVs are off-highway vehicles (OHVs) less than or equal to 50" with three or more low pressure tires, handle-bar steering, and a seat designed to be straddled by an operator.

edom.edomvd: Unknown whether ATV use is allowed

attr.attrdef: Feature geometry.
The identity of the user who last updated the record.

attrdomv.udom: Unique value with no associated domains.

attr.attrdef: Indicates whether four-wheel drive vehicles are allowed. Four-wheel drive vehicles are motorized vehicles designed for or capable of cross country travel on or immediately over land, and greater than 50" in width.

edom.edomvd: Unknown whether four-wheel drive vehicle use is allowed

attr.attrdef: The name of the management area (or areas) the trail or trail segment specifically crosses, if any. Can hold multiple values.
attr.attrdefs: Federal Trail Data Standards, Washington State Geospatial Program Office

attrdomv.udom: Unique value with no associated domains.

attr.attrdef: The national designation assigned to the trail or trail segment. Populate only if applicable.

edom.edomv: MILLENNIUM LEGACY TRAIL WASHINGTON - JOHN WAYNE PIONEER
NATIONAL HISTORIC TRAIL - LEWIS AND CLARK

attr.attrdef: Accessibility guideline compliance status (via American Disability Act or ADA) for the trail or trail segment designed for HIKER/PEDESTRIAN use.

edom.edomvd: Trail determined ineligible to meet current agency accessibility guidelines
Trail meets current agency accessibility guidelines

attr.attrdef: Status of linework and attribute editing.
The user who originally created (or recreated) the record.

attrdomv.udom: Unique value with no associated domains.

attr.attrdef: Is additional review required
Notes added by editor pertaining to data, sometimes including site links referencing where the data or attribute information was obtained.

attrdomv.udom: Unique value with no associated domains.

attr.attrdef: Agency or entity that created the dataset where the original geometry was sourced from. Can hold multiple values.
attr.attrdefs: Federal Trail Data Standards, Washington State Geospatial Program Office

attrdomv.udom: Unique value with no associated domains.

attr.attrdef: A universal unique identifier used to track changes in features and assigned by the geodatabase when a row is created. This field is not editable and is automatically populated when it is added for existing data.
attr.attrdefs: Washington State Geospatial Program Office, ESRI

attrdomv.udom: Unique value with no associated domains.

attr.attrdef: Internal feature number.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The date and time the record was created (or recreated).

attrdomv.udom: Unique value with no associated domains.

attr.attrdef: Indicates whether cross country skiing is allowed. Includes ski mountaineering and hiking downhill skiing/snowboarding when not supported by mechanized vehicles.

edom.edomvd: Unknown whether cross country skiing is allowed.

attr.attrdef: Current physical state of trail or trail segment.

edom.edomvd: Planned or proposed trail identified by an appropriate management decision
A trail that is no longer needed and has been removed from service

attr.attrdef: Indicates whether self-propelled motorized watercraft are allowed. Includes all types of self-propelled motorized watercraft when floating. Excludes amphibious vehicles if any wheel or track is in contact with the ground/substrate.

edom.edomvd: Unknown whether self-propelled motorized watercraft use is allowed.

attr.attrdef: Indicates whether snowmobiles are allowed. Snowmobiles are motorized over-snow vehicles that operate on a track, use one or more skis for steering, have handle bar steering, and a seat designed to be straddled by the operator.

edom.edomvd: Unknown whether snowmobile use is allowed.

attr.attrdef: Indicates whether bicycles and/or mountain bikes allowed.

edom.edomvd: Bicycles and/or mountain bikes are not allowed
Unknown whether bicycle/mountain bike use is allowed

attr.attrdef: Indicates whether snow sleds pulled by dogs allowed.

edom.edomvd: Snow sleds pulled by dogs not allowed.
Snow sleds pulled by dogs allowed.
Unknown whether dog sled use is allowed

attr.attrdef: The travel network with which the trail or trail segment belongs (if applicable). Populate only if applicable or known.
Length of the trail or trail segment in miles. Calculated value (SHAPE_Length / 5280).

attrdomv.udom: Unique value with no associated domains.

attr.attrdef: Indicates whether hiking and backpacking allowed.

edom.edomvd: Unknown whether hiking/backpacking use are allowed.

attr.attrdef: Official name of trail (if any).

attrdomv.udom: Unique value with no associated domains.

attr.attrdef: Provides information (usually a name) that defines the identity of the primary maintainer. Can contain multiple values.
attr.attrdefs: Federal Trail Data Standards, Washington State Geospatial Program Office

attrdomv.udom: Unique value with no associated domains.

attr.attrdef: Pertains specifically to flagged data. Contains notes about edits needed, particularly linework changes.

attrdomv.udom: Unique value with no associated domains.

attr.attrdef: The trail's specific use categories are not defined by the sources available. (See Managed Use Category in the Federal Trail Data Standards, pg. 22.)
attr.attrdefs: Washington State Geospatial Program Office, Federal Trail Data Standards

attr.attrdef: Indicates whether horses (riding) and/or packing stock allowed.

edom.edomvd: Horses (riding) and/or packing stock not allowed.
Unknown whether horses and/or packing stock uses are allowed.

attr.attrdef: Number of trail (if applicable). Primarily used for US Forest Service trails that don't have names or have both names and numbers.

attrdomv.udom: Unique value with no associated domains.

attr.attrdef: Indicates whether non-motorized watercraft allowed. Includes all types of non-motorized watercraft, if floating--canoes, kayaks, inflatable open-top rafts, rowboats, etc.

edom.edomvd: Unknown whether non-motorized watercraft use is allowed.

attr.attrdef: Indicates whether snowshoeing allowed.

edom.edomvd: Unknown whether snowshoe use is allowed.

attr.attrdef: The agency or group having primary maintenance responsibility for the trail or trail segment. Usually the same as the managing organization, but can include trail user groups, volunteers, communities, etc.

edom.edomvd: Town, Township, Municipal Agency (City or other local civic government), County
Federal agency other than those specifically listed

attr.attrdef: Land area of special management concern or interest which the trail or trail segment crosses. Populate only if applicable.

edom.edomvd: Identified by either the Secretary of Agriculture or the Secretary of the Interior
Congressionally designated area or proclaimed by the President
Other federal, state, or local designation
Identified by the Secretary of the Interior

attr.attrdef: Predominant trail surface type or material.

edom.edomvd: Imported uncompacted gravel, pea gravel, sand
Other trail surface types (boardwalk, paver block, geogrid, etc)

attr.attrdef: Agency or entity that provided the source information used to populate the attribute fields. Can hold multiple values.
attr.attrdefs: Federal Trail Data Standards, Washington State Geospatial Program Office

attrdomv.udom: Unique value with no associated domains.

attr.attrdef: The name of the county the trail passes through. Trails that retain their identity while passing through more than one or multiple counties are assigned the 'various' class.
attr.attrdefs: Federal Trail Data Standards, Washington State Geospatial Program Office

attr.attrdef: The date the records were last updated in Greenwich Mean Time.

attrdomv.udom: Unique value with no associated domains.

attr.attrdef: Alternate trail name (if applicable). Mainly for trails that switch names or are known by other names.

attrdomv.udom: Unique value with no associated domains.
